awd_titl_txt: Oceanic Faulting in the Northern Apennine Ophiolites,       Italy
awd_abstract_narration: Ophiolite sequences are of considerable interest as                        exposed examples of ancient seafloor or oceanic rocks.  The                     Jurassic Apennine-Alpine ophiolites are unusual in that they                    have no sheeted dike component with mafic lavas and chert                       directly overlying serpentinite and gabbro.  This project                       will examine the possibility that the top of the                                serpentinite/gabbro basement may be the footwall of a large                     low-angle detachment fault exposed on the seafloor prior to                     eruption of the  mafic lavas.  Results should help develop                      models for ophiolite generation and the role of extensional                     faulting in the subsequent evolution of  the system.

inst.org_lgl_bus_name: RESEARCH FOUNDATION FOR THE STATE UNIVERSITY OF NEW YORK, THE
